definition:
No. See the Note under No. [Obs.]

1. The middle of the day; midday; the time when the sun is in the meridian; twelve o'clock in the daytime. 2. Hence, the highest point; culmination. In the very noon of that brilliant life which was destined to be so soon, and so fatally, overshadowed. Motley. High noon, the exact meridian; midday. -- Noon of night, midnight. [Poetic] Dryden.

Belonging to midday; occurring at midday; meridional. Young.

To take rest and refreshment at noon.
